content: Sorry if this isn't the right way to ask this question or it's not clear what I'm looking for. What I want is a command that takes some valid piece of lean syntax and shows the process of how its elaborated. For example, if you did something like #<hypothetical command> for x in xs do sorry it might print the syntax it came from, the macros and elaborators it used, all the way up to the result you would get with something like #print. Does something like exist? If not, is there a good way I can manually do this? I'm trying to better understand how this process works for common lean features. Thanks!
Zach Battleman has marked this topic as resolved.
